defs: = ಕುಮ್ಮರ.
a girl's dance with clapping of hands to time and singing.
to crush, powder by pounding.
to crush, powder by pounding.
to collapse losing one's strength.
to punch or pierce heavily.
to demolish, spoil completely.
to spread oneself around, all over or throughout.
to rush with great force.
(sl.) sexual intercourse; copulation.
a pounding or beating with a pestle or a heavy object.
a machine, instrument or implement that is defective or useless.
a sham amulet which is not as effective as it made to believe.
a useless engineer or mechanic.
a treacherous man; a machinator.
the act or an instance of cheating.
a ridiculing; derision; a looking down.
a cheat; a deceiver.
one who derides another.
the reaping of crops; harvest.
a cut, as caused by the stroke of a sharp-edged instrument.
a man who reaps; a harvester.
a man who cuts, severes.
to cut (with or as with a knife, sword, etc.).
to pull off or out (as a flower from a plant).
(sneeringly) to play a violin.
(sneeringly) to talk boringly.
the sound uttered by dogs in pain.
the potherb Amaranthus tenuifolius of Amaranthaceae.
to utter sound similar to the one uttered by a dog in pain.
(fig.) to talk timidly in a low tone (as from fear).
a person who is appointed for reaping.

a wooden piece that can be fitted into a hole made in another wooden piece.
a religious observation on the tenth day of child-birth.
to cause to cut.
to cause to harvest.
a Dravidian language prevalent in parts of Madhya Pradesh, in Central India.
a conspiracy or secret plan, esp. to achieve an unlawful end; an underhand plot; an evil design; machination.
a man of wicked devices; a man who works with evil intent; a machinator.
the class of animals other than human, considered as a kingdom of inferior birth.
a low-birth; a low woman's womb (considered as dishonourable birth).
= ಕುಯ್ಗುಱಿ.
a sheep kept for killing either as in a sacrifice or for food.
a stupid person who has become a prey or is victimised.
the sound uttered by dogs in pain.
(in gen.) a wailing sound; a plaintive cry.

the time of the year when matured grain, fruit, vegetables, etc. are reaped and gathered in; harvest.
an inflamed pus-filled swelling caused by infection; a boil; an abscess.
something that pains, irritates a person; an irritant.
the horny part of the foot of a horse, antelope, and other ungulates; the hoof.
= ಕುರಂದ.
any of a family (Cervidae) of ruminants, including the elk, moose, and reindeer; a deer, esp. the smaller species, as the white-tailed deer and mule deer.
a small, hornless deer (Moschus moschiferus) the male of which secretes musk and has tusk like upper canines; the musk deer.
the black-spot on the moon.
the Moon-God, holding the sign of a deer in his hand.
a substance with a strong, penetrating odour, obtained from a small sac (musk bag) under the skin of the abdomen in the male musk deer, used as the basis of numerous perfumes; musk.
a woman whose eyes resemble that of a deer (which do not concentrate on one object).
a holding of one's palm with the fore-finger and the little finger stretched up and other two fingers resting on the thumb.
a tiger, considered as an enemy of deers.
= ಕುರಂಗನೇತ್ರೆ.
any of several families of primates usu. having a flat, hairless face and a long tail; a monkey.
a binding or tying firmly with a rope.
= ಕುರಂದ.
(mus.) a mode, in Karnāṭaka system, derived from the main mode Dhīra Śankarābharaṇa.
= ಕುರಟಿಕೆ.

a common mineral, aluminium oxide, Al2O3, second only to the diamond in hardness, a dark, granular variety of which is used for grinding and polishing; corundum.
name of a language belonging to Dravidian family.
any of the birds Gracula religiosa, Acridotheres tristis, Eulabes religiosa, Tumenuchus pagodarum and Sturnopastor contra, a few of them are able to mimic the human voice, often kept as pet; myna.
to inflict pain; to cause to undergo grief; to torment.
to undergo sufferings, pain, agony; to grieve.
unpleasantness; mental irritation.
annoyance caused by a repeated action.
unduly or overbearingly confident and presuming; arrogance; effrontery.
ಕುರಕುರಿಮಾಡು kurakuri māḍu to show disagreement or create conflict because of differences of opinion, temperment; to embarrass; to trouble.
an iron or steel block on which goldsmiths hammer gold or silver objects into shape; an anvil.
of small stature; undersized; stunted; dwarfish.
the quality or state of being dwarfish; dwarfishness.
a group of under-bush and shrubs.
a thick growth of small trees and underbrush covering an extensive tract of land.
any bush or small tree.
a decorated frame work on a slightly raised platform for putting idols or for the bride and bridegroom to sit in.
a small tower on the fort-wall or building.
a measure of weight for weighing camphor.
a heap; pile.

its flower.

a condiment or seasoning of vermicelli with chillies, salt, etc. dried and fried in oil.
a kind of fish.

any of various families of winged hymenopteran insects, characterised by a slender body with the abdomen attached by a narrow stalk, biting mouthparts, and, in the females and workers, a vicious sting that can be used repeatedly; a wasp.
a thick cord made of intertwisted woollen threads.
the annual plant Lepidium sativum of Brassicaceae family, used as a salad plant; garden cress.
the horny part of the foot of a horse, antelope, and other ungulates; the hoof.
the plant Phoebe wightii of Lauraceae family.
another plant of the same family Phoebe paniculata.
the male, large, black-and-white diving bird of prey, Pandion haliaetus of Pandionidae family which feeds mainly on fish; an osprey.
the female, large, black-and-white diving bird of prey, Pandion haliaetus of Pandionidae family which feeds mainly on fish; an osprey.
a female sheep; an ewe.
to cry out loudly; to scream; to yell.
= ಕುರರ.
a calling out noisily; an outcry; bellowing; bawling.
the plant Barleria buxifolia (var. roseaflora) of Acanthaceae family; prickly purple nail dye.
a woman belonging to a nomadic sect among tribal people in Karnāṭaka, who gen. is a fortune-teller on traditional lines.
a system of dance prevalent in South India.
= ಕುರವ.
the small finchlike bird, Passer domesticus, of the family Ploceidae, with brown and grey plumage; a house sparrow.
a kind of plant (=ಕುರವ - 3 ?).
a long-handled tool with a thin metal blade, used for turning up the soil, weeding etc; a hoe; (?).
a curl of hair.
a usu. cylindrical, thick peg of wood, metal, etc., attached perpendicular to a wall and used for hanging garments etc. on.
the sacred book of Islam believed to contain revelations made to Mohammed by Allah; Koran.
to mark - a) to put or make a mark or marks on; b) to identify or designate by or as by a mark or marks.
to take note of; to give attention to.
to direct one's mind to; to mind.
to direct (spoken or written words) to; to speak or write to; to address.
to apply oil, ointment etc. on skin etc.; to anoint.
to turn oneself from a straight line or from some direction or position; to bend; to become crooked.
the bovid ruminant mammal, Ovis aries, of the genus Ovis with a thick woolly coat, domesticated and kept in flocks for its wool or meat, and is proverbial for its timidity; a sheep.
(fig.) a simple, very timid or stupid person.

ಕುರಿ ಕಾಯು kuri kāyu (derog.) (having proved one's stupidity) to do a job that does not require judgement or reasoning; ಕುರಿಕಾಯುತ್ತೀಯಾ ತೋಳ ಅಂದರೆ, ಸಂಬಳವೇ ಬೇಡ ಎಂದಿತಂತೆ kuri kāyuttīya tōḷa a ndare, sambaḷavē bēḍa enditante (prov.) a prudent man does not make the goat his gardener; ಕುರಿ ಕೊಬ್ಬಿದಷ್ಟೂ ಕುರುಬನಿಗೆ ಲಾಭ kuri kobbidaṣtū kurubanige lābha (prov.) the more fleshier the sheep grows, the more profitable for the slaughterer; ಕುರಿ(ಗಳನ್ನು) ತುಂಬಿದ ಹಾಗೆ ತುಂಬು kuri(gaḷannu) tumbida hāge tumbu to pack like sardine; to jam pack; ಕುರಿ ನಂಬುವುದು ಕಟುಕನನ್ನೇ kuri nambuvudu kaṭuknannē (prov.) people believe those who cheat them, not the honest one; fish follow the bait; ಒಂದು ಕುರಿ ಹಳ್ಳಕ್ಕೆ ಬಿದ್ದರೆ ಎಲ್ಲ ಕುರಿಗಳೂ ಬೀಳುತ್ತವೆ ondu kuri haḷḷakke biddare, ella kurigaḷū bīḷuttave (prov.) ignorants act blindly; If one sheep leaps over the dyke, all the rest will follow.
= ಕುರಿಬಳ್ಳಿ.
a kind of plant which flowers once in twelve years.
(fig.) a very rare thing.
= ಕುರಕಿಸು.

to peck and pick up with the beak.
unpleasantness; mental irritation.
annoyance caused by a repeated action.

the loud, deep sound made by an animal, etc. that roars; roaring.

a person who herds and takes care of sheep; a shepherd.

to kill a sheep.

the act of killing violently; a slaughtering.
an enclosure for sheep; a pen.

a common mineral, aluminum oxide, Al2O3, second only to the diamond in hardness, a dark, granular variety of which is used for grinding and polishing.

the profession, work or status of a shepherd.

the envious or resentful attitude towards another's advantages, merits, wealth, status, etc.; jealousy; envy.

a very young coconut.

a short beard.

ಕುರುಡನ ಕೈಯಲ್ಲಿ ಕನ್ನಡಿ ಕೊಟ್ಟ ಹಾಗೆ kuruḍana kaiyalli kannaḍi koṭṭa hāge (prov.) (proverbial simile) like a blindman holding a mirror; ಕುರುಡನಿಗೆ ಕಣ್ಣು ಬಂದಂತೆ kuruḍanige kaṇṇu bandante (simile) getting a help, advice, etc. at the time of desperation, (like a blindman getting sight); ಕುರುಡನಿಗೆ ಹಗಲೇನು, ಇರುಳೇನು? kuruḍanige hagalēnu, iruḷēnu? (prov.) what use a lantern to a blind person? A mole wants no lanthorn; ಕುರುಡರ ರಾಜ್ಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಒಕ್ಕಣ್ಣನೇ ರಾಜ kuruḍara rājyadalli okkaṇṇanē rāja (prov.) (prov.) he is a giant who has many dwarfs about him; ಕುರುಡರೊಳಗೆ ಮೆಳ್ಳನೇ ಶ್ರೇಷ್ಠ kuruḍaroḷage meḷḷanē śrēṣṭha (prov.) = ಕುರುಡರ ರಾಜ್ಯದಲ್ಲಿ ಒಕ್ಕಣ್ಣನೇ ರಾಜ.
husked, but not polished rice.
to become blind; to lose one's sight.
(blindness) to happen.

a woman deprived of sight; a blind woman; ಕುರುಡಿಯ ಪುಳು kuruḍiya puḷu = ಕುರುಡಿಕುಠಾರ; ಕುರುಡಿ ಮದುವೆಯಾದರೆ ಮನೆ ಗಡಿಗೆಗೆ ಮೂಲ kuruḍi maduveyādare mane gaḍigege mūla (prov.) a worker having no knowledge, would only spoil the implements.

ಕುರುಡು ಓದು kuruḍu ōdu a reading without understanding the meaning; ಕುರುಡು ಕಣ್ಣಿಗೆ ಕಾಡಿಗೆಯಿಟ್ಟಂತೆ kuruḍu kaṇṇige kāḍige iṭṭante (prov.) to do utterly useless thing; to decorate a corpse; ಕುರುಡುಗಣ್ಣುಮಾಡು kuruḍugaṇṇu māḍu to refuse to look at a problem; to be negligent about; to close one's eyes to; ಕುರುಡುಗಣ್ಣಿಗಿಂತ ಮೆಳ್ಳೆಗಣ್ಣು ಮೇಲು kuruḍugaṇṇiginta meḷḷegaṇṇu mēlu (prov.) a single slice of bread is preferred to starving; better a barefoot than no foot at all.
a broken, hence useless, cowrie.
a coin not in currency.

a coin not in currency.
wealth not being used in a wise way.

an eye which is deprived of sight; a blind eye.

an alley or passage shut off at one end; a blind alley.
to give sight to; to enable to see.

a glass not letting light pass through; an opaque glass.

any belief, based on fear or ignorance, that is inconsistent with the known laws of science or with what is generally considered in the particular society as true and rational; esp., such a belief in charms, omens, the supernatural, etc.; a superstition.

being in an early period of life or growth; not old; young.
